questions.question: The maximum generated voltage in power generating stations in advanced countries is 33kV while that in India is _________
The transmission lines and feeders are _____________ .
The transmission lines are _____________
________ are lines conductors which connect the distribution substations to the areas, to be fed by those distribution substations.
________ are the terminals which connect the consumerï¿½s terminals to the distributors
In AC-system ,

answers.a: Electric power can be generated at high voltage
answers.b: Stepping-up and stepping down of an AC voltage can be done easily and efficiently with the help of transformers
answers.c: Transformer line construction is comparatively difficult and the amount of copper required is comparatively more

questions.question: In AC system,

answers.a: There is a need to synchronize the alternators before they are put in parallel
answers.b: As a result of skin effect, the resistance of the line is increased
answers.c: In order to avoid corona loss and also to provide adequate amount of insulation in case of overhead lines, more spacing between the conductors is required

questions.question:
Statement 1:- The best method is to use AC system for generation and distribution purpose and DC system for transmission purpose.
Statement 2:- The best method is to use DC system for generation and distribution purpose and AC system for transmission purpose.

answers.a: Statement 1 is true and Statement 2 is false
answers.b: Statement 1 is false and Statement 2 is false
answers.c: Statement 1 is false and Statement 2 is true
answers.d: Statement 1 is false and Statement 2 is false

questions.question: Underground cables are rarely used for
Important component of overhead lines is
The characteristics that conductors used for transmission and distribution should posses :

answers.a: High tensile strength and low sensitivity

questions.question: Hard drawing of copper __________ electrical conductivity by small amount but it ___________ the tensile strength considerably.

answers.c: Both increases, decreases and Decreases, increases in some cases

questions.question: Copper conductor is

answers.b: Highly durable and has high scrap value
answers.c: It has high current density, so lesser X-sectional area of conductor is required

questions.question: Aluminium is ______________ in weight as compared to copper, but has _________ conductivity and tensile strength.
The sag in aluminium conductors is __________ the copper conductors.
The advantages of using aluminium conductors steel reinforced over aluminium conductor is ________

answers.c: Both tensile strength is increased and skin effect is greatly increased

questions.question: Choose the proper set of increases order of mechanical strength of the following line supports :

answers.a: Wooden poles > steel poles > steel towers > R.C.C poles
answers.b: Wooden poles > steel towers > steel poles > R.C.C poles
answers.c: Wooden poles > steel poles >R.C.C poles > steel towers
answers.d: Wooden poles > R.C.C poles >steel poles > steel towers

questions.question: Characteristics of an insulator used in overhead lines are

answers.a: It should have high electric strength
answers.b: High ratio of rapture strength to flash over voltage

questions.question: A good porcelain insulator has compressive strength of about _________ and dielectric strength of _________ of its thickness.
Glass insulators, can be used up to _________ under normal atmospheric conditions, and in dry atmosphere, it can be used up to __________ .
Steatite is produced by mixing ___________ with small proton of ________ and ___________.
In a pin type insulator,

answers.a: Insulators made of glass are generally used for low voltages
answers.b: Insulators made of poralain can be used up to a 90kv but are rarely used on lines above 60kV
answers.c: Both insulators made of glass are generally used for low voltages and insulators

questions.question: The factor affecting the sag in overhead lines are
Due to skin effect, the total resistance of the conductor _________, as the frequency of the current ________ and also with the increases in the diameter of the conductor.
The skin effect is negligible when the supply frequency is ________ and the conductor diameter is _________.

The alternating magnetic flues in a conductor caused by the current flowing in a neighbouring conductor gives rise to circulating currents which cause an apparent increases in the resistance of the conductor. This phenomena is called ________ .
The factor which effect skin and proximity effects are ______________

answers.c: Size of the conductor and distance between the conductors

questions.question: Usually in short transmission lines ___________

answers.c: Both length is less than 50km and operating voltage is less than 20kV

questions.question: In medium transmission lines

answers.c: Both length is between 50 km and 160km and operating voltage is between 21kV and 100kV

questions.question: In long transmission lines

answers.c: Both length is more than 160km and operating voltage is above 100kV

questions.question: In oil circuit breaker (O.C.B) the range exists between
Advantages of using Air blast Circuit breakers:
In SF6 Circuit breaker
The voltage across the contacts during the arcing period is known as _______
The transient voltage appearing across the contacts during arc period is called ________

When low inductive current is interrupted by a Circuit breaker and the arc generating force of the Circuit breaker and is more than necessary to interrupt a low magnitude of current, the current will be interrupted before its natural zero instant. It is termed as
_______ is the r.m.s value of current which the Circuit breaker is capable of carrying continuously at its rated frequency under specified conditions.
The peak value of current (including the DC component) during first cycle of current wave after the closure of Circuit breaker is known as __________.
__________ is the current (r.m.s value) that a Circuit breaker is capable of breaking under specified conditions and given recovery voltage.
__________ of a Circuit breaker depends upon its ability to withstand the temperature rise and the electromagnetic force effects.
Advantage of using instrument Transformer is

answers.a: Standard rated instruments may be used easily
answers.b: It provides safety for operating personal
answers.c: Both standard rated instruments may be used easily and it provides safety for operating personal

questions.question: Instrument transformers are classified as:

answers.c: Both potential transformer and current transformer

questions.question: Potential transformers are made with

answers.a: Low quality icon core operating at very low flex density so that the magnetizing current may be large
answers.b: High quality icon core operating at very high flex density so that the magnetizing current may be large
answers.c: High quality icon core operating at very high flex density so that the magnetizing current may be very small
answers.d: High quality icon core operating at very low flex density so that the magnetizing current may be very small

questions.question: Potential transformers are carefully designed to ensure

answers.a: Minimum variation of voltage ratio with load and minimum phase shift between input and output voltages
answers.b: Minimum variation of voltage ratio with load and maximum phase shift between input and output voltages
answers.c: Maximum variation of voltage ratio with load and maximum phase shift between input and output voltages
answers.d: Maximum variation of voltage ratio with load and minimum phase shift between input and output voltages

questions.question: A high magnitude alternating current can be measured by a combination of _________ and_________.

answers.a: Potential transformer and a low range ammeter
answers.b: Current transformer and high range ammeter
answers.c: Current transformer and low range ammeter

questions.question: The current transformer ratio is not equal to the ratio of secondary to primary turns.

answers.b: The above statement is false, because of the effect of magnetizing current
answers.c: The above statement is true, because of the effect of magnetizing current

questions.question: _________is used to make sure that an electrical circuit can be completely de-energized for service or maintenance.
The major difference between an isolates and a circuit broken is that

answers.a: A Circuit Breaker is an off load device insulated to be opened only after current has been interrupted by some other after control device
answers.b: An isolator is an off load device intended to be opened only after current has been interrupted by some other control device
answers.c: Both A Circuit Breaker is an off load device insulated to be opened only after current has been interrupted by some other after control device and An isolator is an off load device intended to be opened only after current has been interrupted by some other control device

questions.question: Gas Insulated Switchgear (GIS) offers

answers.a: High reliability, lower stability and maintenance free feature in much larger space compared with conventional switchgear.
answers.b: High reliability, higher safety and maintenance free feature in much larger space compared with conventional switchgear.
answers.c: High reliability, lower safety and maintenance free feature in much smaller space compared with conventional switchgear.
answers.d: High reliability, higher safety and maintenance free feature in much smaller space compared with conventional switchgear.

questions.question: The space requirement of Gas Insulated Switchgear (GIS) can be less than ______ of the space taken up by an equivalent conventional installation.
A ______ is a substation which does not contain transformers and operates only at a single voltage level.
The apparatus used for switching, controlling and protecting the electrical circuit and equipment is known as
Switchgear consist of:

answers.c: Lightning arrestors, current transformers potential transformer etc

questions.question: Functions of switchgear are

answers.a: To localize the effects of faults by operation of protective equipment and so automatically disconnect faulty point from the system
answers.b: To break efficiently the short circuits without giving rise to dangerous conditions
answers.c: To facilitate the redistribution of local, inspection and maintenance on the system

questions.question: Essential features of switchgear are

answers.a: The switchgear must be able to discriminate between faulty and healthy section
answers.c: Provision for manual control and instruments

questions.question: __________ is a hollow insulating lines through which a conductor may pass .
Small porcelain bushing can be used up to _________
The inside of the bushing may contain __________ and the bushing is often filled with ________ to provide additional insulation.
Bus bar can be arranged in ____________

answers.c: Both single bus-bar system and double bus-bar system with sectionalisation

questions.question: The major advantage of single bus-bar system is that fault on one part of the bus'bar or system does not completely shut down the whole station.
_________ is a device which is used to switch from one bus to the other without any interruption in power supply and without creating hazardous arcs.
Lighting arrestor are also called as __________
